trends: There have been 47 other sightings in Sedona
There were no other sightings in Sedona on or around May 22nd 2010
divs: sighting detailslast night i slept outside as i often do when weather permits. i awoke about midnight and remained awake a couple hours according to an inside clock when i went inside briefly. as a star gazer and photographer i am familiar with the rate\speed that meteors usually travel. this night i saw two meteors, but the sighting i am describing was different. as i was looking up nearly overhead (~ 80 degrees up) but slightly to the east a bright "twinkle" caught my eye. i can only estimate the time to be around 02:00 am. in less than a second what appeared to be an extremely fast double streak appeared from the point of the "twinkle". from my perspective it appeared to travel about an inch, moved northward, and lasted less than a second before disappearing. i was impressed by the speed. i am very familiar with movement of satellites and have photographed many iridium satellite flares as well as others. whatever this was appeared to be very high, but moving too fast to be a satellite or meteor.
Summary: Double Streak moves faster than meteor
